=== Pending issues ===

* Full resolution with repositories' graphics driver for SiS VGA (1366x768 or 1368x768?)
* 3D acceleration with any graphics driver
* Good detection of "BisonCam NB Pro" (videocamera) for uvcvideo/V4L2
* Is needed to gnome-sound-recorder autodetect the Mic capture channel for good testing

'''From docummentation'''
* Chipset SiS M672 + SiS 968
* LCD screen: 15,6‚Äù HD 16:9 Wide Screen (1366x768) TFT
* Memory: 2 sockets SODIMM 200Pin DDRII 667MHz, up to 2GiB
* Graphics: Integrated in chipset SiS M672 (shared memory up to 256MiB, 2D/3D acceleration), WebCam (2Mpx)
* Audio: integrated microphone, Mic jack, Headphone jack, S/PDIF jack
* Card slots: 7-in-1 (MMC/RSMMC/SD/MiniSD/MS/MS Pro/MS Duo), ExpressCard 54(34), internal MiniCard for USB and PCI-Express
* Connectivity: Ethernet 8P8C/RJ45 100mbps, wireless 802.11b/g, optional Bluetooth V2.0

=== (*) Notes and recipes ===

==== Correct resolution/refresh ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.04 (Jaunty Jackalope): You can ask to Cioce for a driver, but only supports 32-bit kernel. The Ubuntu's driver works at 800x600 normally, and 1024x768 if there is an external monitor working. Often the Live-CD boots with a cut/phased image, and change to 640x480 and restore 800x600 is needed.

==== Graphic acceleration ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.04 (Jaunty Jackalope): You can ask to Cioce for a driver, but only supports 32-bit kernel and only solves the resolution issue and for the moment only for this Ubuntu version.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.10 (Karmic Koala): As with Ubuntu 9.04 , starts on 800x600 with 2D acceleration with the distribution's driver.

==== External monitor works ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.10 (Karmic Koala): Ubuntu's driver sets the integrated screen (LCD) at 1024x768 , and external monitor at 800x600 , but doesn't manage the monitor's presence.

==== Blank monitor when closing lid ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.10 (Karmic Koala): Also suspends

==== Mic jack ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.10 (Karmic Koala): gnome-sound-recorder doesn't capture the voice

==== Wired NIC ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.04 (Jaunty Jackalope): Not stable. Sometimes after DHCP configuration cannot stablish communication to anything. The same times NetworkManager doesn't detect an unplugged cable.

==== Wireless NIC ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.04 (Jaunty Jackalope): Activation required with keyboard.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.10 (Karmic Koala): Activation required with keyboard.

==== PSTN Modem ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.10 (Karmic Koala): Pending to try scanmodem utility, but in the help's chapter 6 tells about a "Network" connections tool not available in the System-Administration menu.

==== Integrated videocamera ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.04 (Jaunty Jackalope): Cioce provides a Michael Wang's patch for UVCvideo to compile and works, but you will need to recompile it on each kernel update and it's only for Jaunty kernels.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.10 (Karmic Koala): You can try with the <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=8682964|Michael Wang's patch for UVCvideo]]</nowiki>, but you will need to recompile it on each kernel update and it's only for Karmic kernels.

==== Live-CD is functional/practicable ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.04 (Jaunty Jackalope): At 800x600 resolution, and often with the image moved/cut.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 9.10 (Karmic Koala): At 800x600 resolution.
